00038 #ifdef LRUCACHE_DEBUG
00039         #define RECORD_HIT m_hits += 1;
00040         #define RECORD_MISS m_misses += 1;
00041         #define LRUCACHE_DEBUG_INIT m_hits(0), m_misses(0),
00042 #else
00043         #define RECORD_HIT
00044         #define RECORD_MISS
00045         #define LRUCACHE_DEBUG_INIT

00048 enum LRUCacheDeleteType {
00049         LRUDeleteNone,
00050         LRUDeleteObject,
00051         LRUDeleteArray,
00052         LRUFreeMalloc
00053 };
00054 
00055 
00062 template <
00063         typename CachedObjectType, 
00064         typename IdType, 
00065         LRUCacheDeleteType deleteType
00066 >
00067 struct LRUCacheNode {
00068 
00069         typedef LRUCacheNode<CachedObjectType, IdType, deleteType> _Self;
00070         
00071         explicit LRUCacheNode(const IdType &i, CachedObjectType * o, _Self * n)
00072                 : id(i), object(o), next(n), prev(NULL) {}
00073 
00074         IdType id;
00075         CachedObjectType * object;
00076                         
00077         // used to create a linked list of items (for LRU functionality)
00078         _Self * next;
00079         _Self * prev;
00080 };
00081 
00083 template <typename CachedObjectType, typename IdType>
00084 struct LRUCacheNode<CachedObjectType, IdType, LRUDeleteObject> {
00085 
00086         typedef LRUCacheNode<CachedObjectType, IdType, LRUDeleteObject> _Self;
00087         
00088         explicit LRUCacheNode(const IdType &i, CachedObjectType * o, _Self * n)
00089                 : id(i), object(o), next(n), prev(NULL) {}
00090 
00091         ~LRUCacheNode() { if (object) delete object; }
00092 
00093         IdType id;
00094         CachedObjectType * object;
00095                         
00096         // used to create a linked list of items (for LRU functionality)
00097         _Self * next;
00098         _Self * prev;
00099 };
00100 
00102 template <typename CachedObjectType, typename IdType>
00103 struct LRUCacheNode<CachedObjectType, IdType, LRUDeleteArray> {
00104 
00105         typedef LRUCacheNode<CachedObjectType, IdType, LRUDeleteArray> _Self;
00106         
00107         explicit LRUCacheNode(const IdType &i, CachedObjectType * o, _Self * n)
00108                 : id(i), object(o), next(n), prev(NULL) {}
00109 
00110         ~LRUCacheNode() { if (object) delete [] object; }
00111 
00112         IdType id;
00113         CachedObjectType * object;
00114                         
00115         // used to create a linked list of items (for LRU functionality)
00116         _Self * next;
00117         _Self * prev;
00118 };
00119 
00121 template <typename CachedObjectType, typename IdType>
00122 struct LRUCacheNode<CachedObjectType, IdType, LRUFreeMalloc> {
00123 
00124         typedef LRUCacheNode<CachedObjectType, IdType, LRUFreeMalloc> _Self;
00125         
00126         explicit LRUCacheNode(const IdType &i, CachedObjectType * o, _Self * n)
00127                 : id(i), object(o), next(n), prev(NULL) {}
00128 
00129         ~LRUCacheNode() { if (object) free(object); }
00130 
00131         IdType id;
00132         CachedObjectType * object;
00133                         
00134         // used to create a linked list of items (for LRU functionality)
00135         _Self * next;
00136         _Self * prev;
00137 };

00141 template <typename _LRUCacheNode>
00142 struct LRUCacheNodeSorter : public std::binary_function<_LRUCacheNode, _LRUCacheNode, bool>
00143 {
00144         bool operator()(const _LRUCacheNode * const n1, const _LRUCacheNode * const n2)
00145         {
00146                 return n1->id < n2->id;
00147         }
00148 };

00151 
00177 template <
00178         typename CachedObjectType, 
00179         typename IdType, 
00180         LRUCacheDeleteType deleteObject
00181 >
00182 class LRUCache {
00183 public:
00184         
00185         typedef std::size_t                                                                                     size_type;
00186         typedef LRUCacheNode<CachedObjectType, IdType, deleteObject>    Node;
00187         typedef std::vector< Node *>                                                                    NodeArray;
00188         typedef typename NodeArray::iterator                                                    NodeIterator;
00189         typedef LRUCacheNodeSorter<Node>                                                                NodeSorter;
00190         
00191         
00192         explicit LRUCache(const size_type &max_nodes ) 
00193                 : LRUCACHE_DEBUG_INIT
00194                 m_first(NULL), m_last(NULL), m_max_nodes(max_nodes)
00195                 
00196         {
00197                 assert(max_nodes > 2);
00198         
00199                 // +1 is needed for the insert, so that we never need to reallocate
00200                 m_nodes.reserve(max_nodes + 1);
00201         }
00202         
00203         ~LRUCache()
00204         {
00205                 NodeIterator i = m_nodes.begin();
00206                 const NodeIterator end = m_nodes.end();
00207                 for (;i != end; i++)
00208                         delete *i;
00209         }
00210         
00214         CachedObjectType * get(const IdType &id)
00215         {       
00216                 // quick optimization: see if the most recently used object is the
00217                 // one that we're looking for
00218                 if (m_first && m_first->id == id)
00219                 {
00220                         RECORD_HIT
00221                         return m_first->object;
00222                 }
00223         
00224                 // create temporary search object
00225                 Node tmp(id, NULL, NULL);
00226         
00227                 // otherwise, search for the item (sorted search, log n)
00228                 NodeIterator iter = std::lower_bound(m_nodes.begin(), m_nodes.end(), &tmp, NodeSorter());
00229                         
00230                 
00231                 if (iter != m_nodes.end() && (*iter)->id == id)
00232                 {
00233                         Node * node = *iter;
00234                         
00235                         // ensure the node is set up properly
00236                         assert(node == m_first || node->prev);
00237                         assert(node == m_last  || node->next);
00238                 
00239                         // if we found it, move to the beginning of the LRU list
00240                         if (node != m_first)
00241                         {
00242                                 // fix up the last ptr if needed
00243                                 if (node == m_last)
00244                                         m_last = node->prev;
00245                                 else
00246                                         node->next->prev = node->prev;
00247                                 
00248                                 node->prev->next = node->next;
00249                                 
00250                                 // fix up self
00251                                 node->prev = NULL;
00252                                 node->next = m_first;
00253                                 
00254                                 // fix up next guy
00255                                 if (m_first)
00256                                         m_first->prev = node;
00257                                 m_first = node;
00258                         }
00259                         
00260                         RECORD_HIT
00261                         return node->object;
00262                 }
00263                 
00264                 RECORD_MISS
00265                 return NULL;
00266         }
00267         
00275         Node * add(const IdType &id, CachedObjectType * object) WARN_IF_UNUSED
00276         {
00277                 Node * ret = NULL;
00278         
00279                 m_first = new Node(id, object, m_first);
00280                 
00281                 if (m_nodes.empty())
00282                 {
00283                         m_last = m_first;
00284                         m_nodes.push_back(m_first);
00285                         return NULL;
00286                 }
00287                 
00288                 // double-linked list
00289                 m_first->next->prev = m_first;
00290                 
00291                 // if there are too many nodes, then delete one
00292                 if (m_nodes.size() == m_max_nodes)
00293                 {
00294                         assert(m_last);
00295                         
00296                         // remove the item from the end of the LRU list
00297                         m_nodes.erase(find ( m_nodes.begin(), m_nodes.end(), m_last ));
00298                         
00299                         // switch them out
00300                         ret = m_last;
00301         
00302                         m_last = ret->prev;
00303                         m_last->next = NULL;
00304                 }
00305                         
00306                 m_nodes.insert(std::upper_bound(m_nodes.begin(), m_nodes.end(), m_first, NodeSorter()), m_first);
00307                 return ret;
00308         }
00309         
00319         Node * removeOne() WARN_IF_UNUSED
00320         {
00321                 if (m_nodes.empty())
00322                         return NULL;
00323                         
00324                 Node * node = m_nodes.back();
00325                 m_nodes.pop_back();
00326                 
00327                 return node;
00328         }
00329         
00330 #ifdef LRUCACHE_DEBUG
00332         size_type m_hits;
00333         
00335         size_type m_misses;
00336 #endif
00337 
00338 private:
00339 
00340         // this needs to have two lists:
00341         //  - a sorted list that allows fast lookup by ID
00342         //  - a list that is ordered by least recently used
00343         //
00344         // so... as a compromise, we have a sorted list, with an embedded
00345         // linked list created from the nodes
00346 
00347         // this is sorted by ID
00348         NodeArray m_nodes;
00349         
00350         // this is the LRU list
00351         Node * m_first;
00352         Node * m_last;
00353         
00354         size_type m_max_nodes;
00355                 
00356 };
00357

00360 #undef RECORD_MISS
00361 #undef LRUCACHE_DEBUG_INIT

00364 #endif
